p: Both mean temperature seasonality and diurnal temperature range were statistically much higher or higher, respectively, for L. neivai than for L. intermedia. Most records in the bottom left quadrant of the scatter plot (0–25 standard deviations, 6–12 °C) are for L. intermedia (80 out of 112); while most records in the top right quadrant of the scatter plot (25–50 standard deviations, 12–18 °C) are for L. neivai (43 out of 43) (Fig. 1, Table 1).
